title: Some Democratic backers of Josh Shapiro see a missed chance for a Jewish vice president
message:
“I defy any one of them to name a single Jewish Republican governor or a single Jewish Republican U.S. senator.
They can’t, because there are none.”The last Jewish Republican senator was former Sen.
“That’s just called stewardship and accountability.”Most Jewish Americans vote Democratic and are still poised to rally around the Democratic ticket, even without Shapiro.
Only 30% of Jewish voters supported Trump in 2020, while 69% supported Biden, according to AP VoteCast, a sweeping survey of the electorate.
That made Jewish voters one of the religious groups where support for Biden was strongest.
